channel.title: Getting new client to connect
channel.description:
So, you have just got your deob, wtf it wont connect!
This is what you do.
Open client .java and declare String host = "po4.runescape.com"; Put it just under this [code]public class client extends Applet_Sub1 {[/code] Search [code] InetAddress.getLocalHost()[/code] You should have found something like this [code] var_client.method22(Class58.anInt1372 + 32, 765, -29889, 12, 503, "runescape", 420, InetAddress.getLocalHost());[/code] It will look a little diffrent in your deob but will look simular. Now replace [code]InetAddress.getLocalHost() [/code] with [code]InetAddress.getByName(host)[/code]
Hey presto, it connects.

item.title: Getting new client to connect
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

;O Nice. I went in and changed method22 to accept String instead of InetAddress. You way’s better.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting new client to connect
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Rictoo:

Why use deobs?

They are good for understanding the client. I also find them much more fun than bytecode :). Deobs are good, just not really for bots.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting new client to connect
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

So, you have just got your deob, wtf it wont connect!

This is what you do.

Open client .java and declare String host = “po4.runescape.com”;
Put it just under this

public class client extends Applet_Sub1 {
Search

 InetAddress.getLocalHost()

You should have found something like this

var_client.method22(Class58.anInt1372 + 32, 765, -29889, 12, 503, "runescape", 420, InetAddress.getLocalHost());
It will look a little diffrent in your deob but will look simular.
Now replace

InetAddress.getLocalHost()

with

InetAddress.getByName(host)

Hey presto, it connects.

Read full topic
